IN IN IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY

INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY NO. 123 OF 1960 NO. 123 OF 1960 NO. 123 OF 1960

Re: M/s. B.N. Kharwar & Ors.

... Insolvents.

Bank of Baroda.

... Petitioning Creditor.

....

Mr. Y.C. Parikh, Official Assignee present.

.....

CORAM CORAM CORAM : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J.

th th th DECEMBER 2006. DECEMBER 2006. DECEMBER 2006.

P.C. P.C. P.C. : : :

.

An order of adjudication was passed on 21st

February The

Official Assignee

had

declared

the

dividend

to the preferential creditors of Rs.0.07 ps.

in

a

rupee

on

nd July .

At

present

the

aggregate

assets

lying on account of the estate are Rs.13,748.75 as

against he proved preferential liability of Rs.2,54,920.57

ps. and an unsecured liability of Rs.26,16,198.41 ps. In

the present case, no further recoveries are possible.

.

The Official Assignee has prayed that the balance

of

Rs.13,748.75 ps.

i.e Rs.5,616.34 in firm s Account

&

Rs.8,132.41

ps.

in

the

personal

Account

may

be

transferred

to

the

Unclaimed Dividend

Capital

Account

under

Rule of the Bombay Insolvency Rules, and

thereafter,

to

the

Unclaimed Dividend

Capital

Revenue

:2:

Account and the account may be closed for administrative

purpose.

.

Having regard to the circumstances set out in the

report

of

the Official Assignee, there is no reason

why

the

prayer

should not be granted.

Prayer clause (a)

of

the report of the Official Assignee is accordingly

granted.

-----
